intro: Eschscholzia arvensis var. dilatata, commonly known as the broadleaf poppy, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its showy, bright orange to red petals and a distinctive, rounded seed pod. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed areas such as roadsides and fields. Its leaves are broad and lobed, with a rough texture, and it produces numerous small, yellowish-green flowers in the spring. The species is part of the Papaveraceae family, which includes other well-known poppy species.
